intro: Gilia micrantha f. longituba, commonly known as the long-tubed gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are primarily pollinated by hummingbirds, which are attracted to its nectar-rich structure. The species is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and chaparral.
